PARAGRAPH.STRING: (P.R.C.; listen, commonly known as China), is a state in East Asia.
has a coastline of 14,500 kilometres (9,010 mi), and
borders (clockwise from south to northeast) Vietnam, Laos, Myanmar, India, Bhutan, Nepal, Pakistan, Afghanistan, Tajikistan, Kyrgyzstan, Kazakhstan, Russia, Mongolia, and North Korea.
capital is Beijing.
At over 3.7 million square miles (over 9.5 million kmÂ²),
is the third or fourth largest country by area.
is also the world's most populous nation, with over 1.3 billion residents.

was established in 1949, during the closing stages of the Chinese Civil War; in that same year, the previous government of China, the Republic of China (R.O.C), retreated to the island of Taiwan, where it currently remains. Since then,
(PRC) has claimed sovereignty over Taiwan and some nearby islands, which are administered by the Republic of China (R.O.C), and
asserts that

has supplanted the ROC in its legitimacy to govern all of China. The R.O.C on Taiwan rejects these claims, and administers itself as a sovereign state with a democratically elected government and president. Until 1991, Taiwan also claimed to be the sole leader of all of China, as well as Mongolia. The term "mainland China" is sometimes used to denote the area under PRC rule, but usually excludes the two Special Administrative Regions: Hong Kong and Macau.
The Communist Party of China (CPC) has led
under a one-party system since
establishment in 1949. Despite this, nearly half of

economy has been privatized in the past three decades under "Socialism with Chinese characteristics." During the 1980s, these economic reforms helped lift hundreds of millions of people out of poverty, bringing the poverty rate down to less than 9% from 33% of the population.
is the world's fourth largest economy and second largest at purchasing power parity (which is predicted to become the largest by 2020) and
represents
as a permanent member of the UN Security Council and APEC.
is the third largest exporter and importer in the world.
consumes a third of the world's steel, over half of the world's concrete and the second largest importer and consumer of world oil. There are currently more construction projects in
than any other country on Earth. However, due to this mixing of market and planned economies,

is faced with a number of problems associated with each, including unemployment and an increasing rural/urban income gap. Despite these shortcomings, greater prosperity has led to growing Chinese influence in global economic, political, military, scientific, technological, and cultural affairs. Due to
large and stable population,
growing economy and military spending and capabilities,
is often considered an emerging superpower.
